intro: Valeriana litvinovii, commonly known as the Litvinov valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and is known for its medicinal properties. Valeriana litvinovii is valued for its phytochemical compounds, which have been used in traditional medicine for their calming and sedative effects. Its conservation status is currently listed as vulnerable due to habitat loss and overharvesting.
